hints.content:
###The Strategy 

To add $z_1$ and $z_2$, we must find the real and imaginary parts of each point and write them in complex number form. Then we can add these complex numbers and plot their sum.

###Writing $z_1$ and $z_2$ in complex number form

- $z_1$ has a real component of  $\greenD{5}$ and an imaginary component of $\blueD{2}$, so $z_1=\greenD{5}+\blueD{2}i$. 

- $z_2$ has a real component of  $\greenD{-2}$ and an imaginary component of $\blueD{4}$, so $z_2=-\greenD{2}+\blueD{4}i$.

###Add $z_1$ and $z_2$

Now, we can add $z_1$ and $z_2$ numerically. 

>$\begin{align}z_1+z_2&=(\greenD{5}+\blueD{2}i)+(\greenD{-2}+\blueD{4}i)
\\\\&=(\greenD{5-2})+(\blueD{2+4})i
\\\\&=\greenD{3}+\blueD{6}i\end{align}$

###Summary 

The sum of $z_1$ and $z_2$ is plotted below. 

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/98878c3bc86afe750271e3ce213f22ce4ddb1fd9)

###The Strategy 

To add $z_1$ and $z_2$, we must find the real and imaginary parts of each point and write them in complex number form. Then we can add these complex numbers and plot their sum.

###Writing $z_1$ and $z_2$ in complex number form

- $z_1$ has a real component of  $\greenD{7}$ and an imaginary component of $\blueD{1}$, so $z_1=\greenD{7}+\blueD{1}i$. 

- $z_2$ has a real component of  $\greenD{-3}$ and an imaginary component of $\blueD{5}$, so $z_2=-\greenD{3}+\blueD{5}i$.

###Add $z_1$ and $z_2$

Now, we can add $z_1$ and $z_2$ numerically. 

>$\begin{align}z_1+z_2&=(\greenD{7}+\blueD{1}i)+(\greenD{-3}+\blueD{5}i)
\\\\&=(\greenD{7-3})+(\blueD{1+5})i
\\\\&=\greenD{4}+\blueD{6}i\end{align}$

###Summary 

The sum of $z_1$ and $z_2$ is plotted below. 

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/4b2edc578da6e378dd286efded0716199d789486)

###The Strategy 

To add $z_1$ and $z_2$, we must find the real and imaginary parts of each point and write them in complex number form. Then we can add these complex numbers and plot their sum.

###Writing $z_1$ and $z_2$ in complex number form

- $z_1$ has a real component of  $\greenD{-7}$ and an imaginary component of $\blueD{4}$, so $z_1=\greenD{-7}+\blueD{4}i$. 

- $z_2$ has a real component of  $\greenD{4}$ and an imaginary component of $\blueD{-4}$, so $z_2=\greenD{4}-\blueD{4}i$.

###Add $z_1$ and $z_2$

Now, we can add $z_1$ and $z_2$ numerically. 

>$\begin{align}z_1+z_2&=(\greenD{-7}+\blueD{4}i)+(\greenD{4}-\blueD{4}i)
\\\\&=(\greenD{-7+4})+(\blueD{4-4})i
\\\\&=-\greenD{3}+\blueD{0}i\end{align}$

###Summary 

The sum of $z_1$ and $z_2$ is plotted below. 

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/a10fd17b7c4d18e667acbd4aa9ccc37fa55b349e)

###The Strategy 

To add $z_1$ and $z_2$, we must find the real and imaginary parts of each point and write them in complex number form. Then we can add these complex numbers and plot their sum.

###Writing $z_1$ and $z_2$ in complex number form

- $z_1$ has a real component of  $-\greenD{6}$ and an imaginary component of $-\blueD{5}$, so $z_1=-\greenD{6}-\blueD{5}i$. 

- $z_2$ has a real component of  $\greenD{8}$ and an imaginary component of $-\blueD{3}$, so $z_2=\greenD{8}-\blueD{3}i$.

###Add $z_1$ and $z_2$

Now, we can add $z_1$ and $z_2$ numerically. 

>$\begin{align}z_1+z_2&=(-\greenD{6}-\blueD{5}i)+(\greenD{8}-\blueD{3}i)
\\\\&=(\greenD{-6+8})+(\blueD{-5-3})i
\\\\&=\greenD{2}-\blueD{8}i\end{align}$

###Summary 

The sum of $z_1$ and $z_2$ is plotted below. 

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/3442382aaedeeb95195d1e96bf70255f62fbd983)

###The Strategy 

To add $z_1$ and $z_2$, we must find the real and imaginary parts of each point and write them in complex number form. Then we can add these complex numbers and plot their sum.

###Writing $z_1$ and $z_2$ in complex number form

- $z_1$ has a real component of  $\greenD{5}$ and an imaginary component of $\blueD{2}$, so $z_1=\greenD{5}+\blueD{2}i$. 

- $z_2$ has a real component of  $\greenD{2}$ and an imaginary component of $\blueD{5}$, so $z_2=\greenD{2}+\blueD{5}i$.

###Add $z_1$ and $z_2$

Now, we can add $z_1$ and $z_2$ numerically. 

>$\begin{align}z_1+z_2&=(\greenD{5}+\blueD{2}i)+(\greenD{2}+\blueD{5}i)
\\\\&=(\greenD{5+2})+(\blueD{2+5})i
\\\\&=\greenD{7}+\blueD{7}i\end{align}$

###Summary 

The sum of $z_1$ and $z_2$ is plotted below. 

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/c8bc5cfdce651ef084bfb14e459873d42a164536)

###The Strategy 

To add $z_1$ and $z_2$, we must find the real and imaginary parts of each point and write them in complex number form. Then we can add these complex numbers and plot their sum.

###Writing $z_1$ and $z_2$ in complex number form

- $z_1$ has a real component of  $\greenD{8}$ and an imaginary component of $-\blueD{4}$, so $z_1=\greenD{8}-\blueD{4}i$. 

- $z_2$ has a real component of  $-\greenD{2}$ and an imaginary component of $-\blueD{3}$, so $z_2=-\greenD{2}-\blueD{3}i$.

###Add $z_1$ and $z_2$

Now, we can add $z_1$ and $z_2$ numerically. 

>$\begin{align}z_1+z_2&=(\greenD{8}-\blueD{4}i)+(-\greenD{2}-\blueD{3}i)
\\\\&=(\greenD{8-2})+(\blueD{-4-3})i
\\\\&=\greenD{6}-\blueD{7}i\end{align}$

###Summary 

The sum of $z_1$ and $z_2$ is plotted below. 

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/84f3167fd717da8780461ac1c2c52d4bc19995c1)

###The Strategy 

To add $z_1$ and $z_2$, we must find the real and imaginary parts of each point and write them in complex number form. Then we can add these complex numbers and plot their sum.

###Writing $z_1$ and $z_2$ in complex number form

- $z_1$ has a real component of  $-\greenD{6}$ and an imaginary component of $-\blueD{5}$, so $z_1=-\greenD{6}-\blueD{5}i$. 

- $z_2$ has a real component of  $-\greenD{3}$ and an imaginary component of $-\blueD{3}$, so $z_2=-\greenD{3}-\blueD{3}i$.

###Add $z_1$ and $z_2$

Now, we can add $z_1$ and $z_2$ numerically. 

>$\begin{align}z_1+z_2&=(-\greenD{6}-\blueD{5}i)+(-\greenD{3}-\blueD{3}i)
\\\\&=(\greenD{-6-3})+(\blueD{-5-3})i
\\\\&=-\greenD{9}-\blueD{8}i\end{align}$

###Summary 

The sum of $z_1$ and $z_2$ is plotted below. 

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/bf06a770059dab620c6f526592e01258131caf19)

###Writing $z_1$ and $z_2$ in complex number form

- $z_1$ has a real component of  $-\greenD{7}$ and an imaginary component of $\blueD{1}$, so $z_1=-\greenD{7}+\blueD{1}i$. 

- $z_2$ has a real component of  $\greenD{5}$ and an imaginary component of $\blueD{4}$, so $z_2=\greenD{5}+\blueD{4}i$.

###Add $z_1$ and $z_2$

Now, we can add $z_1$ and $z_2$ numerically. 

>$\begin{align}z_1+z_2&=(-\greenD{7}+\blueD{1}i)+(\greenD{5}+\blueD{4}i)
\\\\&=(\greenD{-7+5})+(\blueD{1+4})i
\\\\&=-\greenD{2}+\blueD{5}i\end{align}$

###Summary 

The sum of $z_1$ and $z_2$ is plotted below. 

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/39e20e75026977316b7725a8a841789d288bd775)

To add $z_1$ and $z_2$, we must find the real and imaginary parts of each point and write them in complex number form. Then we can add these complex numbers and plot their sum.

###Writing $z_1$ and $z_2$ in complex number form

- $z_1$ has a real component of  $-\greenD{3}$ and an imaginary component of $-\blueD{3}$, so $z_1=-\greenD{3}-\blueD{3}i$. 

- $z_2$ has a real component of  $\greenD{3}$ and an imaginary component of $-\blueD{3}$, so $z_2=\greenD{3}-\blueD{3}i$.

###Add $z_1$ and $z_2$

Now, we can add $z_1$ and $z_2$ numerically. 

>$\begin{align}z_1+z_2&=(-\greenD{3}-\blueD{3}i)+(\greenD{3}-\blueD{3}i)
\\\\&=(\greenD{3-3})+(\blueD{-3-3})i
\\\\&=\greenD{0}-\blueD{6}i\end{align}$

###Summary 

The sum of $z_1$ and $z_2$ is plotted below. 

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/dc97fc25bb32cddd59b86209d8b65e6cf860ec5b)

###Writing $z_1$ and $z_2$ in complex number form

- $z_1$ has a real component of  $\greenD{8}$ and an imaginary component of $-\blueD{5}$, so $z_1=\greenD{8}-\blueD{5}i$. 

- $z_2$ has a real component of  $-\greenD{5}$ and an imaginary component of $\blueD{5}$, so $z_2=-\greenD{5}+\blueD{5}i$.

###Add $z_1$ and $z_2$

Now, we can add $z_1$ and $z_2$ numerically. 

>$\begin{align}z_1+z_2&=(\greenD{8}-\blueD{5}i)+(-\greenD{5}+\blueD{5}i)
\\\\&=(\greenD{8-5})+(\blueD{-5+5})i
\\\\&=\greenD{3}+\blueD{0}i\end{align}$

###Summary 

The sum of $z_1$ and $z_2$ is plotted below. 

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/54b3d4f08541bfb08b5784c0a834a80c0d111a22)

###Writing $z_1$ and $z_2$ in complex number form

- $z_1$ has a real component of  $\greenD{9}$ and an imaginary component of $-\blueD{3}$, so $z_1=\greenD{9}-\blueD{3}i$. 

- $z_2$ has a real component of  $-\greenD{2}$ and an imaginary component of $\blueD{1}$, so $z_2=-\greenD{2}+\blueD{1}i$.

###Add $z_1$ and $z_2$

Now, we can add $z_1$ and $z_2$ numerically. 

>$\begin{align}z_1+z_2&=(\greenD{9}-\blueD{3}i)+(\greenD{-2}+\blueD{1}i)
\\\\&=(\greenD{9-2})+(\blueD{-3+1})i
\\\\&=\greenD{7}-\blueD{2}i\end{align}$

###Summary 

The sum of $z_1$ and $z_2$ is plotted below. 

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/f3f9609f73830a2151e888d0a06c90a38e60763e)

###Writing $z_1$ and $z_2$ in complex number form

- $z_1$ has a real component of  $-\greenD{9}$ and an imaginary component of $\blueD{4}$, so $z_1=-\greenD{9}+\blueD{4}i$. 

- $z_2$ has a real component of  $\greenD{4}$ and an imaginary component of $-\blueD{6}$, so $z_2=\greenD{4}-\blueD{6}i$.

###Add $z_1$ and $z_2$

Now, we can add $z_1$ and $z_2$ numerically. 

>$\begin{align}z_1+z_2&=(-\greenD{9}+\blueD{4}i)+(\greenD{4}-\blueD{6}i)
\\\\&=(\greenD{-9+4})+(\blueD{4-6})i
\\\\&=-\greenD{5}-\blueD{2}i\end{align}$

###Summary 

The sum of $z_1$ and $z_2$ is plotted below. 

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/a55d5313aea4e7c98b5cecb43b9b13763a7ab84e)

To add $z_1$ and $z_2$, we must find the real and imaginary parts of each point and write them in complex number form. Then we can add these complex numbers and plot their sum.

###Writing $z_1$ and $z_2$ in complex number form

- $z_1$ has a real component of  $-\greenD{9}$ and an imaginary component of $\blueD{8}$, so $z_1=-\greenD{9}+\blueD{8}i$. 

- $z_2$ has a real component of  $\greenD{9}$ and an imaginary component of $-\blueD{3}$, so $z_2=\greenD{9}-\blueD{3}i$.

###Add $z_1$ and $z_2$

Now, we can add $z_1$ and $z_2$ numerically. 

>$\begin{align}z_1+z_2&=(-\greenD{9}+\blueD{8}i)+(\greenD{9}-\blueD{3}i)
\\\\&=(\greenD{-9+9})+(\blueD{8-3})i
\\\\&=\greenD{0}+\blueD{5}i\end{align}$

###Summary 

The sum of $z_1$ and $z_2$ is plotted below. 

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/4da2030422cf77bc0626affe358e3ac22a69da2e)

To add $z_1$ and $z_2$, we must find the real and imaginary parts of each point and write them in complex number form. Then we can add these complex numbers and plot their sum.

###Writing $z_1$ and $z_2$ in complex number form

- $z_1$ has a real component of  $-\greenD{4}$ and an imaginary component of $\blueD{6}$, so $z_1=-\greenD{4}+\blueD{6}i$. 

- $z_2$ has a real component of  $\greenD{7}$ and an imaginary component of $\blueD{1}$, so $z_2=\greenD{7}+\blueD{1}i$.

###Add $z_1$ and $z_2$

Now, we can add $z_1$ and $z_2$ numerically. 

>$\begin{align}z_1+z_2&=(-\greenD{4}+\blueD{6}i)+(\greenD{7}+\blueD{1}i)
\\\\&=(\greenD{-4+7})+(\blueD{6+1})i
\\\\&=\greenD{3}+\blueD{7}i\end{align}$

###Summary 

The sum of $z_1$ and $z_2$ is plotted below. 

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/2ab348306b43f6218fdb1a6872208a0b5a4ec3e7)

###The Strategy 

To add $z_1$ and $z_2$, we must find the real and imaginary parts of each point and write them in complex number form. Then we can add these complex numbers and plot their sum.

###Writing $z_1$ and $z_2$ in complex number form

- $z_1$ has a real component of  $\greenD{3}$ and an imaginary component of $\blueD{2}$, so $z_1=\greenD{3}+\blueD{2}i$. 

- $z_2$ has a real component of  $\greenD{3}$ and an imaginary component of $\blueD{5}$, so $z_2=\greenD{3}+\blueD{5}i$.

###Add $z_1$ and $z_2$

Now, we can add $z_1$ and $z_2$ numerically. 

>$\begin{align}z_1+z_2&=(\greenD{3}+\blueD{2}i)+(\greenD{3}+\blueD{5}i)
\\\\&=(\greenD{3+3})+(\blueD{2+5})i
\\\\&=\greenD{6}+\blueD{7}i\end{align}$

###Summary 

The sum of $z_1$ and $z_2$ is plotted below. 

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/067bb8cb988dad67189c19bdec17652c51904315)

###The Strategy 

To subtract $z_1$ and $z_2$, we must find the real and imaginary parts of each point and write them in complex number form. Then we can subtract these complex numbers and plot their difference.

###Writing $z_1$ and $z_2$ in complex number form

- $z_1$ has a real component of  $\greenD{-1}$ and an imaginary component of $\blueD{4}$, so $z_1=\greenD{-1}+\blueD{4}i$. 

- $z_2$ has a real component of  $\greenD{4}$ and an imaginary component of $\blueD{-2}$, so $z_2=\greenD{4}-\blueD{2}i$.

###Subtract $z_2$ from $z_1$

Now, we can subtract $z_2$ from $z_1$ numerically. 

>$\begin{align}z_1-z_2&=(\greenD{-1}+\blueD{4}i)-(\greenD{4}-\blueD{2}i)
\\\\&=(\greenD{-1-4})+(\blueD{4+2})i
\\\\&=\greenD{-5}+\blueD{6}i\end{align}$

###Summary 

The difference of $z_1$ and $z_2$ is plotted below. 

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/8e4f3491d143b0119c5de9458361faa10aad0316)

###The Strategy 

To subtract $z_1$ and $z_2$, we must find the real and imaginary parts of each point and write them in complex number form. Then we can subtract these complex numbers and plot their difference.

###Writing $z_1$ and $z_2$ in complex number form

- $z_1$ has a real component of  $\greenD{4}$ and an imaginary component of $\blueD{4}$, so $z_1=\greenD{4}+\blueD{4}i$. 

- $z_2$ has a real component of  $\greenD{4}$ and an imaginary component of $-\blueD{4}$, so $z_2=\greenD{4}-\blueD{4}i$.

###Subtract $z_2$ from $z_1$

Now, we can subtract $z_2$ from $z_1$ numerically. 

>$\begin{align}z_1-z_2&=(\greenD{4}+\blueD{4}i)-(\greenD{4}-\blueD{4}i)
\\\\&=(\greenD{4-4})+(\blueD{4+4})i
\\\\&=\greenD{0}+\blueD{8}i\end{align}$

###Summary 

The difference of $z_1$ and $z_2$ is plotted below. 

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/fd27226fcab8a3a0ee5d13bb3836e44c23edf778)

###The Strategy 

To subtract $z_1$ and $z_2$, we must find the real and imaginary parts of each point and write them in complex number form. Then we can subtract these complex numbers and plot their difference.

###Writing $z_1$ and $z_2$ in complex number form

- $z_1$ has a real component of  $-\greenD{5}$ and an imaginary component of $\blueD{6}$, so $z_1=-\greenD{5}+\blueD{6}i$. 

- $z_2$ has a real component of  $-\greenD{5}$ and an imaginary component of $\blueD{4}$, so $z_2=-\greenD{5}+\blueD{4}i$.

###Subtract $z_2$ from $z_1$

Now, we can subtract $z_2$ from $z_1$ numerically. 

>$\begin{align}z_1-z_2&=(-\greenD{5}+\blueD{6}i)-(-\greenD{5}+\blueD{4}i)
\\\\&=(\greenD{-5+5})+(\blueD{6-4})i
\\\\&=\greenD{0}+\blueD{2}i\end{align}$

###Summary 

The difference of $z_1$ and $z_2$ is plotted below. 

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/5796cd44a3ff20a4a73c5d90ab1298145aa9c68c)

###The Strategy 

To subtract $z_1$ and $z_2$, we must find the real and imaginary parts of each point and write them in complex number form. Then we can subtract these complex numbers and plot their difference.

###Writing $z_1$ and $z_2$ in complex number form

- $z_1$ has a real component of  $-\greenD{7}$ and an imaginary component of $\blueD{5}$, so $z_1=-\greenD{7}+\blueD{5}i$. 

- $z_2$ has a real component of  $-\greenD{7}$ and an imaginary component of $-\blueD{3}$, so $z_2=-\greenD{7}-\blueD{3}i$.

###Subtract $z_2$ from $z_1$

Now, we can subtract $z_2$ from $z_1$ numerically. 

>$\begin{align}z_1-z_2&=(-\greenD{7}+\blueD{5}i)-(-\greenD{7}-\blueD{3}i)
\\\\&=(\greenD{-7+7})+(\blueD{5+3})i
\\\\&=\greenD{0}+\blueD{8}i\end{align}$

###Summary 

The difference of $z_1$ and $z_2$ is plotted below. 

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/04af731de6a84c6b8eb0de7320caa2920d7b8ee3)

###The Strategy 

To subtract $z_1$ and $z_2$, we must find the real and imaginary parts of each point and write them in complex number form. Then we can subtract these complex numbers and plot their difference.

###Writing $z_1$ and $z_2$ in complex number form

- $z_1$ has a real component of  $\greenD{4}$ and an imaginary component of $\blueD{0}$, so $z_1=\greenD{4}+\blueD{0}i$. 

- $z_2$ has a real component of  $-\greenD{4}$ and an imaginary component of $\blueD{0}$, so $z_2=-\greenD{4}+\blueD{0}i$.

###Subtract $z_2$ from $z_1$

Now, we can subtract $z_2$ from $z_1$ numerically. 

>$\begin{align}z_1-z_2&=(\greenD{4}+\blueD{0}i)-(-\greenD{4}+\blueD{0}i)
\\\\&=(\greenD{4+4})+(\blueD{0+0})i
\\\\&=\greenD{8}+\blueD{0}i\end{align}$

###Writing $z_1$ and $z_2$ in complex number form

- $z_1$ has a real component of  $-\greenD{4}$ and an imaginary component of $\blueD{0}$, so $z_1=-\greenD{4}+\blueD{0}i$. 

- $z_2$ has a real component of  $-\greenD{6}$ and an imaginary component of $\blueD{0}$, so $z_2=-\greenD{6}+\blueD{0}i$.

###Subtract $z_2$ from $z_1$

Now, we can subtract $z_2$ from $z_1$ numerically. 

>$\begin{align}z_1-z_2&=(-\greenD{4}+\blueD{0}i)-(-\greenD{6}+\blueD{0}i)
\\\\&=(\greenD{-4+6})+(\blueD{0+0})i

###Summary

###Writing $z_1$ and $z_2$ in complex number form

- $z_1$ has a real component of  $-\greenD{5}$ and an imaginary component of $\blueD{3}$, so $z_1=-\greenD{5}+\blueD{3}i$. 

- $z_2$ has a real component of  $-\greenD{8}$ and an imaginary component of $\blueD{7}$, so $z_2=-\greenD{8}+\blueD{7}i$.

###Subtract $z_2$ from $z_1$

Now, we can subtract $z_2$ from $z_1$ numerically. 

>$\begin{align}z_1-z_2&=(-\greenD{5}+\blueD{3}i)-(-\greenD{8}+\blueD{7}i)
\\\\&=(\greenD{-5+8})+(\blueD{3-7})i

###Summary

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/f06690ca9796d0f734c38240e74387ec2e05f45f)

###The Strategy 

To subtract $z_1$ and $z_2$, we must find the real and imaginary parts of each point and write them in complex number form. Then we can subtract these complex numbers and plot their difference.

###Writing $z_1$ and $z_2$ in complex number form

- $z_1$ has a real component of  $\greenD{6}$ and an imaginary component of $\blueD{5}$, so $z_1=\greenD{6}+\blueD{5}i$. 

- $z_2$ has a real component of  $\greenD{3}$ and an imaginary component of $\blueD{4}$, so $z_2=\greenD{3}+\blueD{4}i$.

###Subtract $z_2$ from $z_1$

Now, we can subtract $z_2$ from $z_1$ numerically. 

>$\begin{align}z_1-z_2&=(\greenD{6}+\blueD{5}i)-(\greenD{3}+\blueD{4}i)
\\\\&=(\greenD{6-3})+(\blueD{5-4})i
\\\\&=\greenD{3}+\blueD{1}i\end{align}$

###Summary 

The difference of $z_1$ and $z_2$ is plotted below.

- $z_1$ has a real component of  $\greenD{8}$ and an imaginary component of $\blueD{4}$, so $z_1=\greenD{8}+\blueD{4}i$. 

- $z_2$ has a real component of  $\greenD{4}$ and an imaginary component of $\blueD{1}$, so $z_2=\greenD{4}+\blueD{1}i$.

###Subtract $z_2$ from $z_1$

Now, we can subtract $z_2$ from $z_1$ numerically. 

>$\begin{align}z_1-z_2&=(\greenD{8}+\blueD{4}i)-(\greenD{4}+\blueD{1}i)
\\\\&=(\greenD{8-4})+(\blueD{4-1})i
\\\\&=\greenD{4}+\blueD{3}i\end{align}$

- $z_2$ has a real component of  $-\greenD{3}$ and an imaginary component of $\blueD{1}$, so $z_2=-\greenD{3}+\blueD{1}i$.
